Key Match Events: The Cubs were shut out for the 15th time this season
The Yankees' Clarke Schmidt and Nestor Cortes combined on a four-hit shutout
Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs' playoff odds stood at 1.1% before the game
The crowd of 40,080 was the largest at Wrigley Field in recent weeks
Post-Match Reflections: Ian Happ said the team needs to play better and keep pushing
Cubs President Jed Hoyer acknowledged the wind's impact on the team's offense
Miscellaneous Highlights: The wind blew in on Saturday for the 33rd time at Wrigley in 70 home games
The Cubs are 12-21 when the wind blows in
The team's offense has been dust in the wind at home, combining for five hits with no runs against Yankees pitching the last two days
Others: The series winds up Sunday with an enticing matchup of Gerrit Cole and Jameson Taillon
The Cubs will induct Kerry Wood and Aramis Ramirez into their Hall of Fame
